author: mybrandt
title: SCAMADA SOS
description:
Las estafas están en todas partes y queremos ayudar a los que se ven atrapados y caen en una estafa.
Una solución sencilla para un gran problema.

f6_assessments.q0: The solution is too broad and goes from giving NFTs (whose contribution to the solution is doubtful) to building a worldwide community of people who have been scammed. To improve the proposal, I suggest bringing more objective information, external evidence (data about scams in crypto), or examples of how can your platforms concretely help people.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer has provided no links or external information that ensures his/her experience in the field of helping people who were scammed. Has given no information about technical expertise do develop the products in the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is not clear and repeats statements or alternative versions of the same statements along with its description. Although it has a roadmap, there are no KPIs neither quality indicators. 
It's recommendable that proposer brings those indicators to make the proposal better auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Social Support for people who lost their life savings to scammers is an Important part of any civilized society. There are incidents of people being push to take extreme steps in such scenarios. Therefore there is a scope to host such support sites with in Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claim 30 years Life coach however no references to the past work could be found enclosed, which makes it difficult to assess the capability of the proposer. Moreover, the proposal is also generic to come to a conclution.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a time plan and a breakup of fund requirements. The minting of NFTs and their usage for distress support and training to prevent scams is not clear. In fact, the use of NFT in this scenario needs strong justification which I could not find in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Since this is a Misc challenge its not intended to fullfill a specific challenge goal. As an ICF Coach I support this project.


I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country. Also I am an educator , teaching English both online and in real life and am an ICF Coach in training.As such I am familiar with Neuroscience and its benefits. I am also involved in AI and ML projects.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a reasonable budget for building this project. It has been well laid out and costs are reasonable. 
Author appears to have experience in the area having been a coach for many years BUT The proposer has not given any links to his linkedin profile or FB or any other details. This is critical for a project of this nature as a coachee must know if his coach is competent and capable to solve  the issue, especially if hes in a low mental state due to have been scammed. Hence I have to give a 3 rating for this.
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics are lacking and no time line of activities has been specified. There is no auditable information presented here. so i can give only a 2 rating.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would like to help people from scam is a great idea to bring benefit to community. But when i read this proposal, I still don't understand what would they do to help people from scam. The proposer said too much about motivation, healing themself and a lot of things about the siprit. When people get scam, the biggest problem of them is money. So I think the best way to bring them up is helping them learn more from their mistakes and improve analyze project skill. They will have knowledge for avoiding scam in the future, they don't actually need to heal by this way.
f6_assessments.q1:
"This proposal try to do so many things such as: Help others through your experience, Get it out...write your story, Join others and learn from your mistakes, Become stronger and wiser after a scam. Even proposal would like to create NFT and SOS system. They don't have any detail plan to show what exactly they are going to do.

The proposer have experience about life coach but he/she wants to create NFT. That seem unrelevant experience for this task. So i think he/she should find a developer for NFT to make it achievable"
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal just states what they want to do in general and doesn't have specific tasks for those desires, goals and how to do it. Therefore, it is almost impossible to track and confirm whether the proposal follows the roadmap or not

f6_assessments.q0: I love the idea of this proposal, the team stated a big problem in our world and also usually happens in Cardano community, too. Unfortunately, the team doesn't show any key metrics, my advice for them is they can use the number of active users in their platform, traffic to content and their channels, or the number of members that uses a specific feature in their platform.
f6_assessments.q1: The team shows their vision and goal for each timeline in their roadmap. They also have detail about some key features of the platform but no info about how they implement this project in detail including coding, activities, marketing... or else. They also provide the roadmap in quarters to the end of 2022, and the budget for each quarter is reasonable for what they outlined. But all of these outlines is just say nothing clear about their plan.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap is not much detail and will be hard to audit, moreover they don't have key metrics in the proposal. As if they want, I also recommend in the first comment about the impact.
The good thing is they have a good awareness about the problem in detail and their online of the solution, features of the platform that can address the problem well. Hope that the team can make a better proposal for getting a high score and make this project come true.

f6_assessments.q0: Here I can understand the reality of people being scammed. But I would like to know what is the specific solution here. It is true that with coaching experience and self-help knowledge, we can completely help them spiritually. but to help them to be completely healed we have to go a long way with them. I feel the challenge here is not enough to be able to help people in such situations. I think you should have more specific solutions and also many communities that help with loss psychology not just scams.
f6_assessments.q1: In addition to related experiences I hope to see some profiles of coreteam. With the vision of the roadmap, I see that you are oriented to build blog posts to help others. It would be great if you could show some examples of helping someone who has been scammed. And what makes your team stand out from the psychology community out there? I want a more detailed and clear KPI than just building community and helping with psychology
f6_assessments.q2: In the roadmap, present it to everyone to see that you have real value. Because if you can't bring high applicability, then marketing will not bring great impact. You intend to do NFT in short-term, what is the game here and will it really help the person being scammed. with spending 3000$ on NFT I haven't seen the effect.

solution:
Convertirse en una nueva versión de sí mismo abrazando sus propios errores.
Encontrar apoyo justo después de haber sido estafado.
Cómo lidiar con las propias emociones.
experience:
